cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Lower Florida Keys early Sunday, then turning north-northwest along the west coast of Florida before curving inland over the Florida Panhandle and southwestern Georgia Monday into Tuesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: north of Fernandina Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: north of Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: entire Georgia coast, northeast Florida coast, and South Carolina coast up to South Santee River; significant impacts also along Florida west coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with gusts possibly exceeding 50 kt are likely Monday morning through Monday afternoon.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–6 ft above ground level possible along the southeast Georgia coast, including Brunswick, especially around high tide Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with isolated totals near 20 inches possible, producing flash flooding in coastal southeast Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous surf/rip currents beginning Sunday night.
